```{r}

add_backslashes <- function(input_string) {
  # Use regular expressions to replace single backslashes with double backslashes
  result <- gsub("\\\\", "\\\\\\\\", input_string)
  return(result)
}


longmcq2 <- function(opts) {
  
  
  
  ix <- which(names(opts) == "answer")
  if (length(ix) == 0) {
    stop("The question has no correct answer")
  }
  
  # Encode special characters
  opts2 <- gsub("\'", "&apos;", opts, fixed = TRUE)
  
  # Add mathjax wrapper to LaTeX expressions (fix regex)
  opts2 <- gsub("\\\\\\((.*?)\\\\\\)", "\\\\(\\1\\\\)", opts2)  # Wrap LaTeX expressions correctly
  
  # Generate a unique name for the radio buttons
  qname <- paste0("radio_", paste(sample(LETTERS, 10, T), collapse = ""))
  options <- sprintf('<label><input type="radio" autocomplete="off" name="%s" value="%s"></input> <span>%s</span></label>', qname, names(opts), opts2)
  
  # HTML format for display
  html <- paste0("<div class='webex-radiogroup' id='", qname, "'>",
                 paste(options, collapse = ""),
                 "</div>\n")
  
  # PDF format (no changes here)
  pdf_opts <- sprintf("* (%s) %s  ", LETTERS[seq_along(opts2)], opts2)
  pdf <- paste0("\n\n", paste(pdf_opts, collapse = "\n"), "\n\n")
  
  # Check the output format and return the appropriate version
  out_fmt <- knitr::opts_knit$get("out.format")
  pandoc_to <- knitr::opts_knit$get("rmarkdown.pandoc.to")
  
  add_backslashes( ifelse((is.null(out_fmt) & is.null(pandoc_to)) ||
                            isTRUE(out_fmt == "html") ||
                            isTRUE(pandoc_to == "html"),
                          html, pdf))
  
  
 
}

```

```{r}

            "\\(0.3589652\\)",

)
```

```{r, results='asis'}

```


<button class="custom-button hint" onclick="toggleAlert(event, '√âvaluez la probabilit√© \\(P(X=8)\\) √† l\'aide de la formule de la probabilit√© binomiale: \\( P(X = k) = C^k_n p^{k} (1-p)^{n-k}\\)', 'hint')"> ‚ùì Indice </button> <div class="alert alert-info" style="display: none;"> <strong class="alertType"></strong>: <span class="alertMessage"></span> </div> <div style="margin-top: 4px;"></div> 




<button class="custom-button explanation" onclick="toggleAlert(event, 'Pour calculer la probabilit√© de r√©pondre correctement √† exactement \\(8\\) questions, utilisez la formule de la distribution binomiale : \\(P(X = k) = C^k_n p^{k} (1-p)^{n-k} \\). ## Question 14

Un professeur donne un QCM de \\(10\\) questions √† ses √©tudiants. La probabilit√© qu'un √©tudiant r√©ponde correctement √† une question est de \\(0.7\\). Quelle est la probabilit√© qu'un √©tudiant r√©ponde correctement √† entre \\(6\\) et \\(8\\) questions inclusivement ?
  
  
  
  
```{r}
opts <- c(
  answer = "\\(0.7004233\\)",
  "\\(0.3492134\\)",
  "\\(0.6516539\\)",
  "\\(0.4740934\\)",
  "\\(0.1797624\\)"
)
```

```{r, results='asis'}

```

<button class="custom-button hint" onclick="toggleAlert(event, 'Pour trouver la probabilit√© de r√©pondre correctement √† entre \\(6\\) et \\(8\\) questions, il faut additioner \\(P(X=8), P(X=7) \\text{ et } P(X=6)\\).', 'hint')"> ‚ùì Indice </button> <div class="alert alert-info" style="display: none;"> <strong class="alertType"></strong>: <span class="alertMessage"></span> </div> <div style="margin-top: 4px;"></div>
